summary: Makeover of all Followers, Hirelings, and Housecarls for Skyrim, Hearthfires, Dawnguard, and Dragonborn.
descriptionHtml:
[center][color=lime][size=10]Followers, Hirelings, and Housecarls[/size][/color][/center]
[color=burlywood][font=Comic Sans MS]There are several amazing follower re-placers available throughout our talented Nexus community and I have used most of them at one point or another but I noticed a huge difference in consistency between the characters, and since there wasn't any re-placers that fit what I was looking for, I thought I'd attempt to create that bridge. Followers, Hirelings, and Housecarls was an idea I had to balance a consistent look between the combination of [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/23755/?]Inhabitants of Skyrim - NPC Overhaul[/url] by Rops1981 and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/24273/?]Ethereal Elven Overhaul[/url] by nuska for my game. My earlier mods, Companions and College of Winterhold makeovers were the start of the project, but due to some hardware issues I had to basically start from scratch, hence the new mod page and the rather long time gap since.

Following the same concept as Rops, I incorporated various tweaks to the vanilla versions to enhance their looks while trying to stay close to their original look as possible without going tottally over board. They are completely compatible with all texture re-placers as I have not set them to specific skins. This means that you can use what ever skin, hair, eyes, brows, and beard textures you wish. While my goal is to stay as close to vanilla as possible, some additional alterations were needed such as inventory changes. Keep in mind that while it is better to use re-placer mods for a fresh start, FFH can be installed at any time. If used on a previous save some NPC's may be missing armor, war paints, or other items and need to be "reset". This can be done by entering the command screen, clicking on the NPC, typing disable, then enable. To fix any neck gaps follow the same instructions but before typing disable, type setnpcweight followed by the new weight, then disable, enable, and save (No weights were adjusted in this mod).

Since there are so many characters and already to many files, initial release will be VE or Vanilla Edition. This edition consists of all vanilla based assets with higher res tint masks. Mizz editions or select NPCs will be available at a later date.
[size=6][color=olivedrab]---- Mod Includes ----[/color][/size]
[center][color=cornflowerblue][size=5]--- Followers VE ---[/size][/color]
[img]https://farm5.staticflickr.com/4315/36238923436_26d67da3d4_z.jpg[/img]
[img]https://farm5.staticflickr.com/4309/36146354341_57e9bbfe9a_z.jpg[/img]

[img]https://farm5.staticflickr.com/4291/36146351481_8b51904a48_z.jpg[/img]
[img]https://farm5.staticflickr.com/4312/35474651723_e709e39d5a_z.jpg[/img]
[img]https://farm5.staticflickr.com/4318/35474649053_522296d343_z.jpg[/img]
[img]https://farm5.staticflickr.com/4312/35474646373_a5af90e797_z.jpg[/img]
[img]https://farm5.staticflickr.com/4313/35474643903_c7d2133012_z.jpg[/img]

[color=cornflowerblue][size=5]--- Hirelings VE ---[/size][/color]
[img]https://farm5.staticflickr.com/4303/35474637283_b610c4652a_z.jpg[/img]

[color=cornflowerblue][size=5]--- Housecarls VE ---[/size][/color]
[img]https://farm5.staticflickr.com/4308/35474634893_7e16b3c4c4_z.jpg[/img][/center]

[size=6][color=olivedrab]---- Installation ----[/color][/size]
[color=red][size=4] !! WARNING !![/size][/color]
[color=chocolate]Installing during the middle of saved game can cause NPCs to loose their gear if their inventory has been altered by the installing mod. Make sure you remove any can't live without gear and dismiss your followers before installing. If you have any naked characters after installation it is ok. Nothing to hit the panic button over and launch a nuclear meltdown. Just open the command screen, press the tilde key...looks like this, `, found next to 1 and above the tab. Click on the naked NPC and type resetinventory and hit enter. Then save your game. Give your follower's gear back and continue gaming.[/color]


[b][color=orange][size=3]SUGGESTED[/size][/color][/b]
FHH VE is completely stand alone, you can just install like normal using the proper pack selections under the file download tab.

If you want a solid consistent look for your game, FHH is inteded to work along side [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/23755/?]Inhabitants of Skyrim - NPC Overhaul[/url] by Rops1981 and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/24273/?]Ethereal Elven Overhaul[/url] by nuska and if you feel like getting more bang for your buck, [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58857/?]Hott Argonians with Argonian Feather Hair[/url] by KrittaKitty and Nerd of Prey. Download these mods, and then grab [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/73298/?]Inhabitants of Skyrim NPC Overhaul USLEEP Patch[/url] by Rops1981 and Rentak as well as [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/46067/?]Ethereal Elven Overhaul Patches[/url] by thordir. FHH patches are provided for USLEEP users, EEO users that want to have EEO versions of my elves, and because I made a few of the male NPCs look younger, those that use [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58443/?]SkySight Skins[/url] by fadingsignal can find patches available under the optional downloads section. If you don't care for any of these suggestions, I have provided some additional suggestions at the bottom of the page below my recommended mods.

[b][color=olivedrab][size=3]Requirements[/size][/color][/b]
Skyrim Update 1.9.32.0
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/71214/?]Unofficial Skyrim Legendary Edition Patch[/url] by Unofficial Patch Project Team for the USLEEP users.
To use the high res war paints and tints you MUST have [url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]SKSE[/url] version 1.7.1 or newer installed and you should add these lines to your SKSE.INI:
[color=orange][Display]
iTintTextureResolution=2048[/color]

[b][color=olivedrab][size=3]Manual Installation[/size][/color][/b]
1. Download the file to a temporary location such as your desktop or into a folder on your desktop
2. Extract the files using 7zip or winrar
3. Copy and paste all the files into your Skyrim data folder. Usual path is: Steam\SteamApps\common\Skyrim\Data
4. Launch Skyrim, click on "Data Files" and make sure that the plug-in is activated and move it to the bottom of the list.
5. Play the game.

[b][color=olivedrab][size=3]With NMM[/size][/color][/b]
If using Nexus Mod Manager click the “Download with Manager” button and activate the mod to initialize the installer. If you have other mods that alter the appearance of the Companions make sure to load this after unless you have specific single .esps then load them after this mod.

[size=6][color=chocolate]---- Uninstalling ----[/color][/size]
[b][color=olivedrab][size=3]Manual Uninstallation[/size][/color][/b]
1. Start Skyrim Launcher, click on Data Files and uncheck "CW by Mizzog.esp" file.
2. Delete all the files from your Skyrim data folder.

[b][color=olivedrab][size=3]Uninstallation Via NMM[/size][/color][/b]
1. Open NMM and double click on "CW by Mizzog" to uninstall.

[size=6][color=red]---- Incompatibilities ----[/color][/size]
While this mod works with any skin and hair textures that you currently use, it is not compatible with any other mod or mods that alter the appearance of any NPCs in this mod. If you wish to use a different version of the same NPC along side this mod, then you must install their mod after mine (or vice versa) and let it overwrite my head meshes and face tints. Otherwise you will need to make patches.

[size=6][color=cornflowerblue]---- Credits and Thank You ----[/color][/size]
First I just want to say thank you to you! yes, you!! for downloading my mod and showing your support. Now on to the wonderul community members that allowed me to use thier impressive works!
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/33106/?]Standalone Followers Tutorial[/url] by zzjay
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29624/?]RaceMenu[/url] by Expired

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/74015/?]Equipment Flexibility Project Complete[/url] by RJinthematrix aka mrjentipede
SkyrimKnight and TarinSoul for their amazing war paints (do a google search, not available on Nexus)
Bethesda for creating such a wonderful world to play in.
The mass nexus community for all their wonderful support and work.

[size=6][color=olivedrab]---- Recommended Mods ----[/color][/size]
Now just tweaking a jaw shape, narrowing the eye spacing, or even slapping on some new hair wont do the job completely. Your going to need some additional help. FHH is completely at the mercy of what ever skin, hair, and eye texture you the user has installed. Below are some recommended mods for a strong Vanilla Edition of FHH. **Note these are just a few and what I personally use because I love their look. You can use what ever you want, I just provide the face.

[size=2][color=orange]---- Solid base vanilla ----[/color][/size]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/23755/?]Inhabitants of Skyrim - NPC Overhaul[/url] by Rops1981
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/24273/?]Ethereal Elven Overhaul[/url] by nuska
